summary: This is an email chain from August 25, 2020, between prosecutors from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) and a Managing Assistant U.S. Attorney in West Palm Beach. The SDNY team, prosecuting Ghislaine Maxwell, is seeking to arrange access to review and scan documents from the prior Southern District of Florida (SDFL) investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and his co-conspirators, which are stored in West Palm Beach.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as the person currently being prosecuted by the SDNY team in New York.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The prior SDFL investigation was into Jeffrey Epstein and his co-conspirators.

connections.description: The document references the prior SDFL investigation into Jeffrey Epstein 'and his co-conspirators,' and the SDNY team is prosecuting Maxwell, implying their alleged conspiratorial relationship.

events.title: Coordination for document access
events.description: SDNY prosecutors email a Managing Assistant U.S. Attorney in West Palm Beach to arrange a call and access to documents from the prior SDFL Epstein investigation.

events.title: Prior OPR inquiry document scanning
events.description: A prior OPR (Office of Professional Responsibility) inquiry had occurred where documents were scanned from the West Palm Beach office and sent directly to OPR DOJ accounts.

locations: West Palm Beach Regional Office â€” SDFL
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) was actively prosecuting Ghislaine Maxwell as of August 2020.

SDNY prosecutors sought physical access to documents from the prior Southern District of Florida (SDFL) investigation into Jeffrey Epstein, which were stored in a secure room in the West Palm Beach office.
The materials in West Palm Beach included case files and boxes of files gathered for an OPR (Office of Professional Responsibility) inquiry.
An inventory of the Epstein-related materials existed, and a prior OPR team had successfully scanned documents directly to their DOJ accounts from that location.
The email chain shows inter-district coordination within the DOJ to share investigative materials for the Maxwell prosecution.
